Amount.Description: Crisis stage count where the requirement is met. Cannot be used with an upper or lower bound. Default operator is >=

Percent.Description: Age progression percentage total where the requirement is met. Cannot be used with an upper or lower bound. Default operator is >=

AdjacentBiomeTypes.Description: Comma separated list for biome types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy

AdjacentBuildingTypes.Description: Comma separated list for building types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy

AdjacentFeatureTypes.Description: Comma separated list for feature types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy

AdjacentQuarterTypes.Description: Comma separated list for unique quarter types. Quarter to be adjacent too

AdjacentResourceTypes.Description: Comma separated list for resource types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy

AdjacentTerrainTypes.Description: Comma separated list for terrain types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy

AnyBuilding.Description: All buildings will count.  Be careful, if you don't specify BuildingCount then all buildings will need to meet the adjacencies.

BuildingCount.Description: Count of buildings that meet the adjacencies. Default is all buildings specified

BuildingType.Description: Comma separate list of buildings used to check adjacencies.  Be careful with using buildings which can have multiples in a city, such as improvements, because build order can matter.  In those cases avoid fertility and building adjacencies as they change through the game

DuplicateCount.Description: For each of the adjacencies, the building needs to be adjacent to this many. Each adjaceny group can only have one entry. Doesn't work with river or lake adjacency. If set, needs to at least be 2.

ListCount.Description: For each of the comma seperated listed this is the number in the list that needs to be met.  Default will be all.

Tags.Description: A comma separated list of tag names that we are checking against in this requirement.

cityReligion.Description: If false, checks if the subject follows the religion of the owner of the modifier, not the owner of the city.

hasReligion.Description: if true, only returns true if the city has a religion. Useful for checking the inverse.

Amount.Description: Amount of the biome tiles in range.

ResourceTypes.Description: Which resource are assigned to the city.  Can be a comma separated list.

Amount.Description: The number of slots to check for.

IsHigherLevelCommander.Description: Check if the commander in a commander's radius is higher level

AfterTurn.Description: Sets a turn requirement X after the requirement starts

MinimumTurn.Description: Turn where the requirement is met and will always be met.

Scale.Description: Scales the turns with game speed

Turn.Description: Turn where the requirement is met.  After this turn passes requirement will never be met

AgeCount.Description: The age count to check for

Challenges.Description: The Challenge IDs that have to be completed.

CompleteAll.Description: Select this if all challenges listed have to be completed (instead of defining a Threshold).

Threshold.Description: The number of challenges that have to be completed, can be any subset from the challenge list.

ConstructibleType.Description: The specific constructible to check for

Amount.Description: Amount of techs player is behind. Cannot be less than 1

CivilizationType.Description: Comma seperated list of civilizations that player must be one of.

IsPastCivilization.Description: If true, will look at the players past civilizations to determine if they were one of the listed

Repeatable.Description: Whether the requirement is met every time the threshold is met

DifferentThanFounded.Description: Conquered city must be different than founded religion

DifferentThanMajority.Description: Conquered city must be different than majority religion

HasReligion.Description: Conquered city must have a religion

IsAssociatedWonder.Description: Used to specify a civs associated wonder instead of a specific wonder.  This will override Wonder parameter if it was also filled in.

Wonder.Description: The specified wonder. It does use the constructible database, but will throw out non-wonder constructibles

AllPlayers.Description: Counts all alive majors.  It is an error to set with OnlyDistantLandsPlayers or OnlyHomelandsPlayers.

Amount.Description: How many players to count.  Default will count if another player has at least 1 settlement following your religion.  It is an error to set this and AllPlayers.

MajorityOnly.Description: Counts only players if their majority religion is your founded religion.

OnlyDistantLandsPlayers.Description: Counts only players in distant lands.  It is an error to set with AllPlayers or OnlyHomelandsPlayers.

PlayerFounded.Description: Counts only the player's founded religion.

PlayerMajority.Description: Counts only the player's majority religion.

LegacyPathType.Description: The legacy path to check for completed milestones

UnitType.Description: If defined, the player must possess at least 1 'UnitType' or (if IgnoreCities is false) the player must possess at least one city.

WithAll.Description: Whether it's required for the player to initiate diplomacy with all other major civs (discards the Amount value if true).

ActiveAtGoldenAge.Description: If true, checks active tradition only at start of golden age. Defaults to false

Amount.Description: How many tokens are invested into the independent
The least number of buildings to match the requirement

BuildingTag.Description: The tags to be matched in an OR statement fashion

Amount.Description: The least number of buildings to match the requirement

AfterInit.Description: Sets a turn requirement.  Gossip occurrences before the story was initialized will not be considered.  If used with AfterTurn, the higher of the two will be used instead

AfterTurn.Description: Sets a turn requirement.  Gossip occurrences before the turn set will not be considered. If used with AfterInit, the higher of the two will be used instead

Amount.Description: How many of the listed gossips must have occurred for the requirement to be met.  Functions as an and/or manipulation

Distance.Description: Some gossips have a tile location where it occurred.  This sets a max distance of where two gossips must have occurred in order to be met.  If there are more than two gossips in the requirement, this will not check and will always be not met.  Default -1 means it isn't considered.

DuplicateCount.Description: When using 1 gossip requirement, how many of the same gossip must be met. Error to use multiple entries.

GossipTypes.Description: Comma separated list of gossips to check against.  Each of these gossips becomes a new argument that can be used to provide additional parameters for the gossip.  This does expect two additional characters at the end to allow for duplicate gossip types with different parameters. eg If you want to check two GOSSIP_PILLAGE, enter GOSSIP_PILLAGE01 and GOSSIP_PILLAGE02.  The two additional characters must always be entered, regardless of duplicates or amount.

TurnWindow.Description: A turn window in which the gossips must have occurred for the requirement to be met. The earliest gossip occurrence and the last must be within that turn window.  Default -1 means it isn't considered.

UnitTag.Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType

IsOwner.Description: True for if you own the settlement, false if city is revolting in your favour

CommanderCount.Description: How many commanders need the number of maxed disciplines.

MaxedDisciplineCount.Description: The required number of maxed disciplines per commander.

CommanderCount.Description: How many commanders need the number of promotions.

DomainType.Description: What type of commanders to look at

CompletedProgressionTreeType.Description: The type of the tree to see if it was completed.

TreesCompleted.Description: The amount of trees to see if they were completed.

TreesInProgress.Description: The amount of trees to see that are currently in progress.

ActionType.Description: The diplomacy action group. If not set will be all action types.

Amount.Description: How many actions have been completed. If both Amount and PlayerAmount are set it is an error.
How many nodes must we have unlocked?

CultureOnly.Description: Do we only care about Civics nodes?

MasteredOnly.Description: Do we only count Mastered nodes?

TechOnly.Description: Do we only care about Tech nodes?

Amount.Description: How many great works it should be filled with, if unused will default to max for the constructible

ConstructibleType.Description: The constructible to check against if filled.

DistantLands.Description: If true, it only counts settlements on distant lands

OtherOnly.Description: If true, it only counts the players settlements

Repeatable.Description: Whether the requirement is met every time the threshold is met

Threshold.Description: The amount of plots revealed on which the requirement is met

Amount.Description: The amount of settlements founded on which the requirement is met

OnlyTowns.Description: Whether the requirement only counts settled towns (via Settlers) towards the amount

DynamicProgressEventName.Description: The name of an event that we need to send the dynamic progress data to.

YieldType.Description: The type of the yield that player has to gain in order to meet this requirement.

GovernmentType.Description: The government type to check for.

EventOperator.Description: The type of improvement that gets fertilized by random event

ImprovementType.Description: The type of improvement that gets fertilized by random event

Amount.Description: The number of resources slotted

ResourceClassType.Description: The resource class type, such as RESOURCECLASS_FACTORY

UniqueQuarterType.Description: Set Value to the enum for the quarter or set to NO_QUARTER if want to check presence of ANY unique quarter

Amount.Description: How many other players must you have alliances with?

IsExactAmount.Description: Are we unmet when you have more than this many alliances?

IsRepeatable.Description: Will we trigger more than once?

Amount.Description: The number of settlements to check for.
The amount of masteries (technological and cultural) reached on which the requirement is met
How many other players must you have this relationship with?
The required number of different religions.

MajorityOnly.Description: The religions must be the majority in a city.

ResourceClass.Description: Which resources to check the player has.

ResourceType.Description: Which resources to check the player has.  Can be a comma separated list.

BiomeType.Description: A list of biome types, if multiple biome types are given the count will include settlements in both types.

OnlyDistantLands.Description: If true, only counts settlements in distant lands.

Amount.Description: The required number of settlements that must follow a religion. Defaults to all settlements.

OnlyFounded.Description: If true, the cities must follow a religion you founded. Defaults to true

AllPlayers.Description: Whether to sum up all players for amount.

Amount.Description: The required number of trade routes established

DomainType.Description: Is this boost to land routes or sea routes

Amount.Description: How many other players must you have alliances with?

CivilizationType.Description: A war with a specific (other) Civilization?

DeclaredByOpponent.Description: Exclude wars declared by the owner?

Amount.Description: The amount of support required. If MoreThanOpponent or LessThanOpponent is set, then it is difference of tokens between for/against. Otherwise it is total tokens

LessThanOpponent.Description: bool for if we are checking for less support than opponents. Amount will compare total against minus total for.

MoreThanOpponent.Description: bool for if we are checking for more support than opponents. Amount will compare total for minus total against.

IdeologyType.Description: To specify a specific opposing ideology.

AgeProgressionMilestoneType.Description: The milestone which has been achieved.

AnyOverbuild.Description: Overbuilding doesn't track improvements, but this will allow it.  Not compatible with NewCosntructibleType.

NewConstructibleType.Description: The constructible replacing the old one

PlotsRevealed.Description: The amount of plots revealed on which the requirement is met

Count.Description: The number of times a player must have reconquered a settlement they lost in the same age.

AnyWonder.Description: Whether to trigger on building any wonder.

BuildingType.Description: The building both endpoints must have.

ResourceType.Description: Which resource to check for trading.  Can be a comma separated list.

Amount.Description: The number of trade routes to have with each of the players.
The amount of unique trade partners required.  If amount and percent not specified it is every major player

Percent.Description: The percent of alive players to trade with. If amount and percent not specified it is every major player

ResourceType.Description: Which resource to check for trading.  Can be a comma separated list.

Amount.Description: The required number of resources gained from a trade route

UnitTag.Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType
Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType

Place.Description: The minimum place required to be met, or if specific, the exact place that needs to be met

Specific.Description: Wether the place needs to be exact, or at a minimum

VictoryClass.Description: The victory class type to check

IncludeCenter.Description: Whether or not to include the center hex.
Whether or not to include the center hex.

ConstructibleType.Description: The specific constructible to check for

Tag.Description: The constructible tag to check for

SingleWarCount.Description: Reinforcement calls count during a single war.

Amount.Description: The minimum number of packed units to check for

CountCombatUnits.Description: Whether or not to count combat units

CountNonCombatUnits.Description: Whether or not to count noncombat units

Tags.Description: Comma separated unit tags that a unit has to pack

Amount.Description: The threshold amount to check

friendlyOnly.Description: Whether to only check the owner's units or all units.

DistrictType.Description: The required district type. All types are included if this is empty

Owned.Description: Is it required that the player owns the district?

DistrictType.Description: A list of the district types to check for. Requirement will be met if unit is occupying any of those types

Friendly.Description: Wether or not to only check for districts in friendly territory

MatchAllTags.Description: Set true if the unit must match all supplied tags. Default behavior is that only one provided tag needs to match.

Tag.Description: A comma separated list of tags to match with the unit.
